name: Reflective journal Entities
text:
week 1   
during my first week at domain, i was tasked with familiarizing myself with the working 
environment and the team, understanding the objectives and deliverables of the description 
classification project and identifying the areas where i can contribute and learn. to achieve 
these goals, i participated in several activities:  
  
firstly, i attended an it induction session to set up my technical working environment. this 
allowed me to understand the tools and infrastructure used in the project, and how to navigate 
domain database using python connected with snowflakes.  
  
i also participated in an orientation session with the data team and human resources, which 
helped me gain a better understanding of domain’s culture, value, and the allocation of the 
data department. additionally, i participated in weekly team meetings with my supervisor and 
team members, where i learned about ongoing projects and asked related questions. i found 
the experience of receiving exceptional team support to be particularly rewarding during the 
first week. the supportive efforts of the team supervisor, teammate, it support, data engineer 
provided detailed instructions and solutions to technical and project-related issues, which 
helped me to quickly acclimate to my internship role and feel comfortable within the team.  
  
one of the most difficult experiences i faced during the first week was learning new technical 
skills and adapting to a new work environment. however, i approached these difficulties with 
a positive attitude and a willingness to ask and learn. i am grateful for the supportive 
environment that i am in, as it has made the learning process easier.  
  
overall, i gained a solid understanding of the project data infrastructure, as well as the tools 
using for retrieving, processing, analyzing data and knowledge sharing. additionally, i got to 
know my supervisor and team members, which has helped me feel more comfortable in my 
role and allowed me to establish strong working relationships with my colleagues. i look 
forward to continuing to learn and contribute to the project in the coming weeks.  
  
week 2  
this week was all about getting started with the description classification project. my focus 
was on data exploration and cleaning, which was challenging but rewarding. i learned a lot 
about the importance of accurate data labeling and how it can impact the outcome of the 
project.  
  
one of the most rewarding experiences of the week was collaborating with my supervisor and 
colleagues. i had the opportunity to learn from their expertise and insights, and i also shared 
my own ideas and findings. i realized that effective communication and collaboration are 
crucial for the success of any project, and i will make sure to continue to engage with my 
team in this way.   
  
one of the most difficult aspects of the week was working with large amounts of text data. 
processing this type of data requires a lot of effort and attention to detail, and it can be 
 
challenging to derive meaningful insights from unstructured data. however, i found this 
experience to be valuable as it helped me to improve my problem-solving and analytical 
skills. i also gained knowledge and skills related to data cleaning, annotation, and filtering 
with keywords.   
  
overall, i made good progress in week 2 and was excited to continue exploring the data and 
refining our approach to the project. i was looking forward to the next phase of the project 
and to continuing to work closely with my team.  
  
week 3  
one of the primary goals for the week was to participate in weekly team meetings and stay 
informed about ongoing projects. i attended weekly team meetings with my supervisor and 
colleagues to gain insights and learn about their work. during these meetings, i shared my 
progress and asked for clarification on related topics. by participating in these meetings, i 
developed a better understanding of the project objectives and use cases. i also learned how to 
present my findings effectively and provide background information to first-time audiences.  
  
another important activity for the week was to conduct thorough data exploration and 
annotation. i worked on updating and expanding the keyword extraction process with my 
supervisor. we added new development properties to the keyword list and applied it to the 
records which had agreement on data labels from both data sources. however, during the 
process, i encountered a challenge in keyword extraction. initially, i did not use generalized 
rules for extracting keywords and ended up including a large number of overly specific and 
specialized keywords in the keyword list. as a result, i spent more time cleaning and refining 
the keyword list. but it was a valuable learning experience, and i gained a deeper 
understanding of the importance of using appropriate rules and criteria for selecting 
keywords.  
  
throughout the week, i also had the opportunity to develop my skills in pycharm, which is a 
more powerful tool for programming use cases, particularly in a professional setting. i 
learned how to use pycharm for data cleaning and preparation, which helped me to improve 
the efficiency of the data cleaning process.   
  
in conclusion, this week was a valuable learning experience for me. i gained new knowledge 
and skills in keyword extraction, data cleaning, and presentation design. i also had the 
opportunity to collaborate with my supervisor and colleagues, which helped me to better 
understand the project objectives and use cases. despite the challenges that i encountered; i 
view them as valuable learning opportunities. i'm looking forward to applying my new 
knowledge and skills in the coming weeks and contributing to the project's success.  
  
week 4  
during the fourth week of my internship, i continued to work on building an accurate training 
dataset for the project. this week was particularly rewarding because i was able to refine my 
understanding of the project goals and work collaboratively with my team to develop 
effective solutions.  
  
one of rewarding experience was developing a comprehensive data cleaning and annotation 
plan for the existing dataset. this required analyzing the dataset's infrastructure and 
 
collaborating with team members to implement the plan using best practices and efficient 
workflows. through this process, i learned how to break down a complex problem into 
manageable steps and work collaboratively with others to achieve a common goal. i also 
learned how to effectively communicate my ideas and receive feedback from my team 
members.  
  
one of the most challenging experiences of this week was experimenting with different 
algorithms to predict labels for the dataset. this required a great deal of trial and error, and 
sometimes the results were unpredictable and led to no meaningful outcomes. however, i 
learned to manage the experience results by summarization and list pros and cons of each 
algorithm which proved to be a good way to record and report the work have been done and 
documentation to the future experiements.  
  
during this week, i learned about the importance of keywords importance and how to 
establish a comprehensive list that informed the development of the algorithms. i also gained 
a deeper understanding of cosine similarities and zero-shot text classification. in terms of 
skills, i learned how to diagnose and fix library import problems and transitioned from using 
jupyter notebook to pycharm, which helped streamline coding efficiency and productivity.  
  
looking back on the past four weeks, i have come to appreciate the importance of asking 
questions and seeking guidance from my supervisor and team members. i have also learned 
that effective communication and collaboration are essential to achieving project goals. 
through my work on the project, i have gained new knowledge and skills that will be 
valuable in my future work. i have also developed a deeper appreciation for the complexity 
and challenges of nlp and the importance of building a clean training dataset.  
  
in conclusion, the fourth week of my internship was a rewarding and challenging experience. 
through collaborating with my team members and participating in discussions, i gained a 
deeper understanding of the project goals and developed effective solutions. i also gained 
new knowledge and skills that will be valuable in my future work. while there were certainly 
challenges along the way, i learned that persistence and effective communication are key to 
achieving success. i was excited to continue working on this project and to see how it 
develops in the weeks to come.  
  
week 5  
during week 5, my primary goal was to continue building up the training dataset for our 
project. to achieve this, i analyzed the existing dataset's infrastructure and worked with my 
colleagues to develop a comprehensive data cleaning and annotation plan. this plan aimed to 
ensure that our dataset was clean, accurate, and labeled consistently, which is crucial for 
training effective machine learning models.  
  
one of the key activities i engaged in during the week was applying experiments on the 
openai pretrained zero shot classification model. this helped me to compare its 
performance with the other models we were working with. through these experiments, i 
gained a deeper understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of each model and established 
a baseline for easily checking and comparing labeling in the next steps.  
  
 
in addition to the experiments, i also compared the performance of three different models in 
predicting labels for data that did not contain refined keywords. this was an important task as 
it helped us develop solutions for prediction label conflicts, which could be problematic 
during the training process. i categorized the data based on their original labels and prediction 
labels and randomly checked the property description text based on prediction results.  
   
overall, i gained several new knowledge and skills during week 5. for example, i learned 
about zero shot text classification and openai pretrained models. i also developed new skills 
in importing and applying openai pretrained models and developed solutions for prediction 
label conflicts. these experiences provided me with valuable insights into the field of nlp 
and increased my confidence in building effective ml models.  
  
one of the rewarding experiences during the week was realizing the importance of reviewing 
and sharing my thoughts with professionals on the team. by doing so, i received feedback 
and insights that helped me to improve my work and develop better solutions. i also 
appreciated the ongoing support and guidance provided by my supervisor and team members, 
which enabled me to ask questions and seek help when needed.  
  
however, there were also challenging experiences during the week, such as randomly reading 
through many properties’ descriptions. this was time-consuming and mentally taxing, but it 
was also beneficial as it helped me gain a deeper understanding of the industry, filter correct 
keywords, and identify relevant information quickly.  
  
in conclusion, week 5 was an exciting and productive week, and i was pleased with the 
progress made towards our project goals. i was also grateful for the opportunity to learn new 
knowledge and skills, work with a supportive team, and apply my skills to real-world 
problems.  
  
week 6  
this week, i continued to work on the data cleaning and annotation tasks for our project. 
specifically, i focused on checking and dropping duplicate data to ensure the integrity of our 
training dataset. i also reran the code to verify that the changes i made did not affect the 
performance of the models we were using.  
  
finally, i finalized the training data and loaded it onto snowflake, our cloud data 
warehousing platform. the process of checking and dropping duplicate data was 
timeconsuming but necessary to avoid bias and overfitting in our models. i used python 
pandas library to identify the duplicated rows based on their property descriptions and labels. 
after examining the results, i decided to drop the duplicated rows and keep only the first 
occurrence of each unique description. this helped to reduce the size of our dataset and 
improve the quality of the remaining data.  
  
once i finished the data cleaning and annotation tasks, i reran the code to verify that the 
changes did not affect the performance of the models we were using. i also used pycharm to 
streamline the coding process and improve my productivity. finally, my supervisor loaded the 
finalized training data onto snowflake.  
  
 
in conclusion, this week's efforts had brought us one step closer to achieving our project 
goals. i was looking forward to seeing how the finalized training data would perform in the 
next phase of the project and to continue learning and growing through this experience. 
 
week 7 
during the seventh week of my internship at domain group, my primary goals involved 
active participation in team meetings and discussions and initiating the analysis of training 
data for modelling experiments. to align my work with project goals, i maintained regular 
communication with my supervisor and participated in team meetings for updates and 
clarifications. 
i conducted feature engineering using bags of words (like tf-idf) and trained data using a 
naïve bayesian model. this hands-on experience contributed significantly to my 
understanding of property description data and honed my skills in nlp model building and 
analysis. 
the process of understanding and selecting features for the models was challenging, as it 
required a deep understanding of the data and careful attention to ensure no valuable 
information was overlooked. 
one of the most rewarding aspects of this week was the opportunity to discuss ideas with 
experienced team members. their feedback and insights greatly helped improve my work and 
devise more effective solutions. 
these experiences, both challenging and rewarding, were instrumental in my professional 
growth. the skills and knowledge i acquired this week have laid a solid foundation for my 
future career in data science. as i progress in my internship, i intend to apply these learnings 
to enhance my approach to feature selection and model building. 
 
week 8  
in the eighth week of my data internship at domain group, my objectives centered around 
evaluating models based on a cleaned training dataset using various feature engineering 
techniques and models. these included naive bayes, logistic regression, random forest, 
word2vec, and distilbert. as usual, an integral part of my activities involved active 
participation in team meetings and discussions. 
i completed model training based on the training dataset, utilizing different models and 
feature engineering techniques. the outcomes were compared and visualized, fostering a deep 
understanding of the impact of different techniques and models on performance. 
simultaneously, i further developed my skills in nlp model building and analysis, 
implementing regularization and early stopping techniques to prevent overfitting. 
the gained knowledge extended to strategies for model evaluation using different techniques 
and preventing overfitting. skills development centered around evaluating and comparing 
models and understanding feature engineering based on different strategies. this week's 
experience offered a substantial opportunity to evaluate models based on over 100,000 new 
data points and work with large, computationally demanding models. 
two experiences stood out as particularly rewarding this week: achieving a high f1 score of 
98% on the logistic regression model with tf-idf vectorization and feature engineering, 
and collaborating with colleagues to receive feedback that helped refine my work. 
however, a significant challenge arose in training the distilbert model, primarily due to the 
specific data size and the time required to fit the model. this difficulty emphasized the 
importance of efficient computation management when dealing with large datasets and 
 
complex models. these insights and experiences will undoubtedly contribute to my ongoing 
learning and professional growth in the data science field. 
 
week 9  
during the ninth week of my internship at domain group, my goals remained focused on 
evaluating models using various feature engineering techniques such as naive bayes, 
logistic regression, random forest, word2vec, and distilbert. actively participating in 
team meetings and discussions continued to provide valuable insights and collaborative 
opportunities. 
i evaluated different models on a cleaned training dataset and compared and visualized the 
results. this process allowed me to gain an in-depth understanding of how these techniques 
and models impact model performance. consequently, my skills in nlp model building, 
analysis, and regularization techniques to prevent overfitting were further improved. 
one crucial knowledge point was understanding how to use cross validation in model 
evaluation. my skills in comparing models using various feature engineering techniques were 
enhanced, and the experience of model evaluation and selection proved enlightening. 
a rewarding experience was evaluating models on different new datasets. it became clear 
how high-quality data can improve model performance significantly. however, some 
difficulties emerged, particularly regarding the accuracy of evaluation data labels. to address 
this, i applied a data cleaning pipeline to improve the data and performed a false positive 
analysis to find ways to enhance the model and rectify any label correctness issues. 
despite these challenges, my experiences during this week offered valuable lessons in data 
management, model evaluation, and teamwork, providing instrumental skills that will be 
beneficial in my future career in data science. 
 
week 10  
during the tenth week of my data internship at domain group, my primary goals were to 
evaluate a new dataset comprising over 100,000 instances, ensure the correctness of original 
data labels, fit the finalized data to a logistic regression model, and work on a docker 
container for deployment. the overarching aim was to achieve an overall f1 score of 0.98. 
to meet these goals, i started by evaluating the new dataset and performed a label correctness 
check. to address any label correctness issues, a data cleaning pipeline was applied. 
following this, the finalized dataset was fitted to a logistic regression model. a significant 
part of my activities was participation in team meetings and discussions, where i presented 
the project's progress. 
the outcomes of these activities were successful: the new dataset was evaluated, label 
correctness ensured, and an impressive f1 score of 0.98 was achieved with the logistic 
regression model. progress on the docker container for deployment was also notable. 
in terms of new knowledge and skills, i became familiar with docker containerization for 
deployment and improved my ability to check label correctness and fit data to a logistic 
regression model. presenting project progress in team meetings was an enriching experience 
that enhanced my team communication and presentation skills. 
the most rewarding experiences included practicing new technologies like docker 
containerization, seeing the impact of high-quality data on model performance, and 
participating in team communication and presentations. however, the week was not without 
its challenges. ensuring the correctness of over 2,000 false positive labels and improving the 
model's performance was a considerable task, as was applying a data cleaning pipeline to 
address label correctness problems. despite these difficulties, the week's experiences 
 
provided valuable lessons and practical experience that will be beneficial in my future data 
science career. 
 
week 11  
during the eleventh week of my internship, my objectives were primarily focused on the 
deployment process of our best-performing model. the goals included setting up a local 
virtual environment following the git repository's docker format and utilizing a makefile. i 
aimed to use linting tools to ensure code correctness and adherence to best practices. i also 
planned to successfully run the application locally using app.run and create a docker image 
for pushing it to github, subsequently triggering the ci/cd process. 
to achieve these goals, i set up a local virtual environment using docker and makefile as 
specified in the git repository. i utilized linting tools for code correctness and maintaining 
best practices. after verifying the application's functionality by running it locally with 
app.run, i created a docker image and pushed it to github. this move initiated the ci/cd 
process, which was a crucial learning point for me. 
the week was successful as i managed to initiate the deployment process for the top-
performing model and set up a local virtual environment. i ensured code correctness through 
linting, verified the application's functionality by running it locally, and finally, triggered the 
ci/cd process by pushing a docker image to github. 
this week was particularly enriching in terms of knowledge, skills, and experience. i learned 
about docker formats for setting up a virtual environment, the utility of makefile for 
environment setup, docker image creation, and the ci/cd process. the skills i improved on 
included setting up a local virtual environment, using linting tools, running applications 
locally, and creating docker images. 
rewarding experiences included collaborating with my team to tackle license and technical 
problems, setting up the local virtual environment, and initiating the ci/cd process. learning 
new deployment concepts and technologies contributed greatly to my professional growth. 
on the other hand, understanding these new deployment concepts and implementing them 
were challenging, requiring a considerable effort to overcome. however, these difficulties 
have served as steppingstones for my learning journey, preparing me for similar challenges in 
the future.

week 2  
this week was all about getting started with the description classification project. my focus 
was on data exploration and cleaning, which was challenging but rewarding. i learned a lot 
about the importance of accurate data labeling and how it can impact the outcome of the 
project.  
  
one of the most rewarding experiences of the week was collaborating with my supervisor and 
colleagues. i had the opportunity to learn from their expertise and insights, and i also shared 
my own ideas and findings. i realized that effective communication and collaboration are 
crucial for the success of any project, and i will make sure to continue to engage with my 
team in this way.   
  
one of the most difficult aspects of the week was working with large amounts of text data. 
processing this type of data requires a lot of effort and attention to detail, and it can be 
 
challenging to derive meaningful insights from unstructured data. however, i found this 
experience to be valuable as it helped me to improve my problem-solving and analytical 
skills. i also gained knowledge and skills related to data cleaning, annotation, and filtering 
with keywords.   
  
overall, i made good progress in week 2 and was excited to continue exploring the data and 
refining our approach to the project. i was looking forward to the next phase of the project 
and to continuing to work closely with my team.

week 3  
one of the primary goals for the week was to participate in weekly team meetings and stay 
informed about ongoing projects. i attended weekly team meetings with my supervisor and 
colleagues to gain insights and learn about their work. during these meetings, i shared my 
progress and asked for clarification on related topics. by participating in these meetings, i 
developed a better understanding of the project objectives and use cases. i also learned how to 
present my findings effectively and provide background information to first-time audiences.  
  
another important activity for the week was to conduct thorough data exploration and 
annotation. i worked on updating and expanding the keyword extraction process with my 
supervisor. we added new development properties to the keyword list and applied it to the 
records which had agreement on data labels from both data sources. however, during the 
process, i encountered a challenge in keyword extraction. initially, i did not use generalized 
rules for extracting keywords and ended up including a large number of overly specific and 
specialized keywords in the keyword list. as a result, i spent more time cleaning and refining 
the keyword list. but it was a valuable learning experience, and i gained a deeper 
understanding of the importance of using appropriate rules and criteria for selecting 
keywords.  
  
throughout the week, i also had the opportunity to develop my skills in pycharm, which is a 
more powerful tool for programming use cases, particularly in a professional setting. i 
learned how to use pycharm for data cleaning and preparation, which helped me to improve 
the efficiency of the data cleaning process.   
  
in conclusion, this week was a valuable learning experience for me. i gained new knowledge 
and skills in keyword extraction, data cleaning, and presentation design. i also had the 
opportunity to collaborate with my supervisor and colleagues, which helped me to better 
understand the project objectives and use cases. despite the challenges that i encountered; i 
view them as valuable learning opportunities. i'm looking forward to applying my new 
knowledge and skills in the coming weeks and contributing to the project's success.

algorithm which proved to be a good way to record and report the work have been done and 
documentation to the future experiements.  
  
during this week, i learned about the importance of keywords importance and how to 
establish a comprehensive list that informed the development of the algorithms. i also gained 
a deeper understanding of cosine similarities and zero-shot text classification. in terms of 
skills, i learned how to diagnose and fix library import problems and transitioned from using 
jupyter notebook to pycharm, which helped streamline coding efficiency and productivity.  
  
looking back on the past four weeks, i have come to appreciate the importance of asking 
questions and seeking guidance from my supervisor and team members. i have also learned 
that effective communication and collaboration are essential to achieving project goals. 
through my work on the project, i have gained new knowledge and skills that will be 
valuable in my future work. i have also developed a deeper appreciation for the complexity 
and challenges of nlp and the importance of building a clean training dataset.  
  
in conclusion, the fourth week of my internship was a rewarding and challenging experience. 
through collaborating with my team members and participating in discussions, i gained a 
deeper understanding of the project goals and developed effective solutions. i also gained 
new knowledge and skills that will be valuable in my future work. while there were certainly 
challenges along the way, i learned that persistence and effective communication are key to 
achieving success. i was excited to continue working on this project and to see how it 
develops in the weeks to come.

children.name: week 5
children.text: week 5
children.goal: week 5

children.name: week 5 during
children.text:
week 5  
during week 5, my primary goal was to continue building up the training dataset for our 
project. to achieve this, i analyzed the existing dataset's infrastructure and worked with my 
colleagues to develop a comprehensive data cleaning and annotation plan. this plan aimed to 
ensure that our dataset was clean, accurate, and labeled consistently, which is crucial for 
training effective machine learning models.  
  
one of the key activities i engaged in during the week was applying experiments on the 
openai pretrained zero shot classification model. this helped me to compare its 
performance with the other models we were working with. through these experiments, i 
gained a deeper understanding of the strengths and weaknesses of each model and established 
a baseline for easily checking and comparing labeling in the next steps.  
  
 
in addition to the experiments, i also compared the performance of three different models in 
predicting labels for data that did not contain refined keywords. this was an important task as 
it helped us develop solutions for prediction label conflicts, which could be problematic 
during the training process. i categorized the data based on their original labels and prediction 
labels and randomly checked the property description text based on prediction results.  
   
overall, i gained several new knowledge and skills during week 5. for example, i learned 
about zero shot text classification and openai pretrained models. i also developed new skills 
in importing and applying openai pretrained models and developed solutions for prediction 
label conflicts. these experiences provided me with valuable insights into the field of nlp 
and increased my confidence in building effective ml models.  
  
one of the rewarding experiences during the week was realizing the importance of reviewing 
and sharing my thoughts with professionals on the team. by doing so, i received feedback 
and insights that helped me to improve my work and develop better solutions. i also 
appreciated the ongoing support and guidance provided by my supervisor and team members, 
which enabled me to ask questions and seek help when needed.  
  
however, there were also challenging experiences during the week, such as randomly reading 
through many properties’ descriptions. this was time-consuming and mentally taxing, but it 
was also beneficial as it helped me gain a deeper understanding of the industry, filter correct 
keywords, and identify relevant information quickly.  
  
in conclusion, week 5 was an exciting and productive week, and i was pleased with the 
progress made towards our project goals. i was also grateful for the opportunity to learn new 
knowledge and skills, work with a supportive team, and apply my skills to real-world 
problems.

children.name: week 6
children.text: week 6
children.goal: week 6

children.name: week 6 this
children.text:
week 6  
this week, i continued to work on the data cleaning and annotation tasks for our project. 
specifically, i focused on checking and dropping duplicate data to ensure the integrity of our 
training dataset. i also reran the code to verify that the changes i made did not affect the 
performance of the models we were using.  
  
finally, i finalized the training data and loaded it onto snowflake, our cloud data 
warehousing platform. the process of checking and dropping duplicate data was 
timeconsuming but necessary to avoid bias and overfitting in our models. i used python 
pandas library to identify the duplicated rows based on their property descriptions and labels. 
after examining the results, i decided to drop the duplicated rows and keep only the first 
occurrence of each unique description. this helped to reduce the size of our dataset and 
improve the quality of the remaining data.  
  
once i finished the data cleaning and annotation tasks, i reran the code to verify that the 
changes did not affect the performance of the models we were using. i also used pycharm to 
streamline the coding process and improve my productivity. finally, my supervisor loaded the 
finalized training data onto snowflake.  
  
 
in conclusion, this week's efforts had brought us one step closer to achieving our project 
goals. i was looking forward to seeing how the finalized training data would perform in the 
next phase of the project and to continue learning and growing through this experience.

children.name: week 7
children.text: week 7
children.goal: week 7

children.name: week 7 during
children.text:
week 7 
during the seventh week of my internship at domain group, my primary goals involved 
active participation in team meetings and discussions and initiating the analysis of training 
data for modelling experiments. to align my work with project goals, i maintained regular 
communication with my supervisor and participated in team meetings for updates and 
clarifications. 
i conducted feature engineering using bags of words (like tf-idf) and trained data using a 
naïve bayesian model. this hands-on experience contributed significantly to my 
understanding of property description data and honed my skills in nlp model building and 
analysis. 
the process of understanding and selecting features for the models was challenging, as it 
required a deep understanding of the data and careful attention to ensure no valuable 
information was overlooked. 
one of the most rewarding aspects of this week was the opportunity to discuss ideas with 
experienced team members. their feedback and insights greatly helped improve my work and 
devise more effective solutions. 
these experiences, both challenging and rewarding, were instrumental in my professional 
growth. the skills and knowledge i acquired this week have laid a solid foundation for my 
future career in data science. as i progress in my internship, i intend to apply these learnings 
to enhance my approach to feature selection and model building.

children.name: week 8
children.text: week 8
children.goal: week 8

children.name: week 8 in
children.text:
week 8  
in the eighth week of my data internship at domain group, my objectives centered around 
evaluating models based on a cleaned training dataset using various feature engineering 
techniques and models. these included naive bayes, logistic regression, random forest, 
word2vec, and distilbert. as usual, an integral part of my activities involved active 
participation in team meetings and discussions. 
i completed model training based on the training dataset, utilizing different models and 
feature engineering techniques. the outcomes were compared and visualized, fostering a deep 
understanding of the impact of different techniques and models on performance. 
simultaneously, i further developed my skills in nlp model building and analysis, 
implementing regularization and early stopping techniques to prevent overfitting. 
the gained knowledge extended to strategies for model evaluation using different techniques 
and preventing overfitting. skills development centered around evaluating and comparing 
models and understanding feature engineering based on different strategies. this week's 
experience offered a substantial opportunity to evaluate models based on over 100,000 new 
data points and work with large, computationally demanding models. 
two experiences stood out as particularly rewarding this week: achieving a high f1 score of 
98% on the logistic regression model with tf-idf vectorization and feature engineering, 
and collaborating with colleagues to receive feedback that helped refine my work. 
however, a significant challenge arose in training the distilbert model, primarily due to the 
specific data size and the time required to fit the model. this difficulty emphasized the 
importance of efficient computation management when dealing with large datasets and 
 
complex models. these insights and experiences will undoubtedly contribute to my ongoing 
learning and professional growth in the data science field.

children.name: week 9
children.text: week 9
children.goal: week 9

children.name: week 9 during
children.text:
week 9  
during the ninth week of my internship at domain group, my goals remained focused on 
evaluating models using various feature engineering techniques such as naive bayes, 
logistic regression, random forest, word2vec, and distilbert. actively participating in 
team meetings and discussions continued to provide valuable insights and collaborative 
opportunities. 
i evaluated different models on a cleaned training dataset and compared and visualized the 
results. this process allowed me to gain an in-depth understanding of how these techniques 
and models impact model performance. consequently, my skills in nlp model building, 
analysis, and regularization techniques to prevent overfitting were further improved. 
one crucial knowledge point was understanding how to use cross validation in model 
evaluation. my skills in comparing models using various feature engineering techniques were 
enhanced, and the experience of model evaluation and selection proved enlightening. 
a rewarding experience was evaluating models on different new datasets. it became clear 
how high-quality data can improve model performance significantly. however, some 
difficulties emerged, particularly regarding the accuracy of evaluation data labels. to address 
this, i applied a data cleaning pipeline to improve the data and performed a false positive 
analysis to find ways to enhance the model and rectify any label correctness issues. 
despite these challenges, my experiences during this week offered valuable lessons in data 
management, model evaluation, and teamwork, providing instrumental skills that will be 
beneficial in my future career in data science.

children.name: week 10
children.text: week 10
children.goal: week 10

children.name: week 10 during
children.text:
week 10  
during the tenth week of my data internship at domain group, my primary goals were to 
evaluate a new dataset comprising over 100,000 instances, ensure the correctness of original 
data labels, fit the finalized data to a logistic regression model, and work on a docker 
container for deployment. the overarching aim was to achieve an overall f1 score of 0.98. 
to meet these goals, i started by evaluating the new dataset and performed a label correctness 
check. to address any label correctness issues, a data cleaning pipeline was applied. 
following this, the finalized dataset was fitted to a logistic regression model. a significant 
part of my activities was participation in team meetings and discussions, where i presented 
the project's progress. 
the outcomes of these activities were successful: the new dataset was evaluated, label 
correctness ensured, and an impressive f1 score of 0.98 was achieved with the logistic 
regression model. progress on the docker container for deployment was also notable. 
in terms of new knowledge and skills, i became familiar with docker containerization for 
deployment and improved my ability to check label correctness and fit data to a logistic 
regression model. presenting project progress in team meetings was an enriching experience 
that enhanced my team communication and presentation skills. 
the most rewarding experiences included practicing new technologies like docker 
containerization, seeing the impact of high-quality data on model performance, and 
participating in team communication and presentations. however, the week was not without 
its challenges. ensuring the correctness of over 2,000 false positive labels and improving the 
model's performance was a considerable task, as was applying a data cleaning pipeline to 
address label correctness problems. despite these difficulties, the week's experiences 
 
provided valuable lessons and practical experience that will be beneficial in my future data 
science career.

children.name: week 11
children.text: week 11
children.goal: week 11

children.name: week 11 during
children.text:
week 11  
during the eleventh week of my internship, my objectives were primarily focused on the 
deployment process of our best-performing model. the goals included setting up a local 
virtual environment following the git repository's docker format and utilizing a makefile. i 
aimed to use linting tools to ensure code correctness and adherence to best practices. i also 
planned to successfully run the application locally using app.run and create a docker image 
for pushing it to github, subsequently triggering the ci/cd process. 
to achieve these goals, i set up a local virtual environment using docker and makefile as 
specified in the git repository. i utilized linting tools for code correctness and maintaining 
best practices. after verifying the application's functionality by running it locally with 
app.run, i created a docker image and pushed it to github. this move initiated the ci/cd 
process, which was a crucial learning point for me. 
the week was successful as i managed to initiate the deployment process for the top-
performing model and set up a local virtual environment. i ensured code correctness through 
linting, verified the application's functionality by running it locally, and finally, triggered the 
ci/cd process by pushing a docker image to github. 
this week was particularly enriching in terms of knowledge, skills, and experience. i learned 
about docker formats for setting up a virtual environment, the utility of makefile for 
environment setup, docker image creation, and the ci/cd process. the skills i improved on 
included setting up a local virtual environment, using linting tools, running applications 
locally, and creating docker images. 
rewarding experiences included collaborating with my team to tackle license and technical 
problems, setting up the local virtual environment, and initiating the ci/cd process. learning 
new deployment concepts and technologies contributed greatly to my professional growth. 
on the other hand, understanding these new deployment concepts and implementing them 
were challenging, requiring a considerable effort to overcome. however, these difficulties 
have served as steppingstones for my learning journey, preparing me for similar challenges in 
the future.
